text: Michelle's eyes slowly open. She's back on the mattress, thin blanket covering her again. A tray of food sits on the floor next to the bed. The two four and shovel are gone. Howard sits on a folding chair by the door, his forearm i now wrapped with a bandage where she hit him with the woo She peers at him through the dim light. Is he sleeping? props herself up. His voice cuts through the darkness, startling her --

You should eat the eggs. You’1ll be dreaming of fresh food before long. Michelle looks at the tray of food, then back to Howard - detachment in his voice, intelligence in his weary eyes. combination that makes him hard to read.
In a couple of weeks, everything's going to be from a can. Panic sets in again. Michelle grabs her cell. Holds it up
I called the police. They'll be here any minute. Let me go now. You'll be in a lot less trouble. Michelle shoots him a defiant look. Howard shakes his head --
You've got no idea what happened, do you? Michelle lowers her cell but doesn’t respond.
There was an attack last night. Some kind of bomb exploded. The city’s destroyed. Michelle looks at Howard like he’s a lunatic.
Yeah... Right.
I was rushing back here when I came across your wrecked car. I couldn’t just leave you there.
If you're such a good samaritan why the hell am I locked in this room?
I spent all night setting your leg and closing that wound on your head. I needed some sleep and didn't want you wandering off. (rubs his bandaged arm) Or cracking my head open with a shovel.
You really think I'm stupid enough to fall for this?
I think you're smart enough to know that if I was gonna do something, I would have done it already.
How do I know you didn't? I woke up in my underwear with no idea where I am or how I got here. That's pretty fucking disturbing.
I’m a doctor. I had to take off your jeans to set your knee.
I want out of here. Now.
You can’t leave. The entire countryside is blanketed with... with some sort of poisonous chemical.
You’re out of your mind.
You go outside, you die. But this place has a filtration system. It should protect us from whatever is floating in the air out there.
What's gonna protect me from you? Howard shakes his head, knows he's not going to convince of anything right now. He stands up. Michelle pulls the blanket tighter around her neck.
You need to rest. (pointing at the tray) That's Ketamine in the small cup. It'll help with the pain. I recommend you take it... but I'll leave that up to you.
Special K? We going clubbing?
I'm a veterinarian. It's the strongest painkiller I have.
Thought you said you were a doctor.
A veterinarian is a doctor. He points to her leg as he tries for a little levity.
Hey. Consider yourself lucky. If you were a horse, I would’ve had to put you down. Michelle’s not laughing.
Thanks, Doc. But I’m not taking a date rape drug while being held prisoner. He takes a step toward her... and there’s a tiny shift in Howard, something stirs beneath his calm exterior --

If I wanted to drug you, I would've crushed it up in your food or hid it in your drink. Or shot you up with it while you were already unconscious. And then I could’ve done what ever I wanted. Michelle looks sick to her stomach. Howard takes a deep breath, knows he went too far.
This is a lot to take in. For both of us. You need to eat and you need to sleep. (MORE )

There will be plenty of time to talk when you're feeling better. Michelle pulls the tray onto her mattress and starts pick at the eggs. She’s not convinced of Howard's story but realizes that either way, she's fucked.

Call me if you need anything. I'll be right outside. That doesn't make her feel any better. He exits the room, leaving the door open behind him. Michelle waits a beat.. She sets the food tray back on the floor. Her hand lingers, grabs the butter knife. She tries to pull herself up, but her weight shifts to he busted knee. The pain is excruciating. Michelle grits her teeth, falls back onto the mattress, e watering. She can’t take it. She grabs the Ketamine off t tray and drinks it. She tucks the butter knife under her pillow and passes ou

(Note: All of the flashbacks are grainy and high contrast it's hard to tell whether we are watching history, a memo or something altogether different.) Dozens of college students drink from plastic cups and bo to hip hop music in the basement of an off-campus house. In a back corner Michelle stands across from PATRICK (19) Despite the raging party going on around them, the expressions on their faces say that they're not having fu
Lauren's in my lit class. We were just studying...
It took you ten minutes to close your books and come downstairs?
I didn't hear you knock. I didn't even know you were coming.
I wanted to surprise you. God, I'm such an idiot. Michelle takes a long drink from her cup.
Nothing happened.
I saw the way she looked at you... the way she looked at me. She locks eyes with Patrick, daring him to lie.
Okay. She kissed me... But I didn't kiss her back.
What the hell does that even mean?
It means you can trust me.
Trust you? Why? So you can hurt me?
Michelle, I love you.
Yeah? You got a fucked up way of showing it. Michelle chugs the rest of her beer, throws the empty cup Patrick and charges for the stairs. He chases after her.
You can't go. You need to sober up. Michelle pushes through the crowd of bodies, ignoring him

Michelle wakes up. The fluorescent bulb is off but a bit light bleeds through the open door along with some noise HAMMERING and SANDING. It puts an anxious look on her fac  10. The food tray is gone. She reaches under her pillow. The butter knife is gone too. A folded t-shirt and women’s drawstring athletic shorts sit on the floor next to her c Michelle reaches over, grabs her cell and opens up her te - all six from Patrick. The last one at 2:42 a.m. -- “Sor had to end this way. I wish we could be 2gether 4ever.” Is he referring to the attack? She shakes the thought fro her head. Michelle swaps her torn, blood-crusted blouse for the t- shirt. It’s skintight but it’s clean. She then gingerly p the shorts on over her wounded knee. Michelle looks around the empty room. She calls out --

Hey, Doc? These luxury accommodations come with a bathroom? Howard enters carrying crutches made out of some nailed together pieces of wood -- there’s material wrapped aroun the tops, sanded hand grips and duct taped feet at the bottom. They're rudimentary, but nonetheless impressive. He sets the crutches down by her mattress.

My name’s Howard. Michelle doesn’t say anything as she pulls herself up ont the crutches. Howard reaches for her arm to steady her. She instinctively pulls away from his touch. He gets the message, turns and leads the way out of the r

Michelle enters the cramped living area. It’s windowless the same low ceilings and cinder block walls. Her eyes dart around, studying every square inch -- In the middle there’s a small table with two folding chai To her right, there's a kitchenette alongside a cupboard. Next to the cupboard, an open door leads to another room.  11. To her left, a worn couch blocks a set of stairs that disappear up into darkness. And on the far side of the room, there's a fully stocked, floor-to-ceiling wine rack that takes up the entire wall for one corner where there's a closed steel door with a deadbolt above the handle. Howard leads Michelle through the main living area into - HOWARD’S ROOM A mattress on the floor. A small chest of drawers against wall. In the back, two shower curtains come together to square off the corner. Howard pulls one of the curtains aside to reveal a toilet sink, a small mirror, and a tub. Michelle crutches by him.
Howard lets the curtain go but stands right outside.
Yeah, um, a little privacy, Doc. Howard heads toward the door.
Let me know if you need any help.

You can help by closing the door on your way out. Through the slit in the shower curtain Michelle watches Howard exit. He closes the bedroom door behind him. Michelle quickly crutches into -- HOWARD’S ROOM She hobbles to the chest of drawers and starts rooting through them. The top drawer is filled with women’s cloth The second drawer down contains men’s clothes.  12. Michelle opens the third drawer revealing a cornucopia of pharmaceuticals, including the Ketamine, antibiotics and few syringes. Michelle grabs a syringe. As she lifts it, she notices a collection of old survival magazines underneath -- A headline on the cover of one of them catches her eye -- “HOW TO MAKE A WEAPON OUT OF ANYTHING.”

You okay in there, Michelle? Michelle startles at hearing her name. She drops the syri and shuts the drawer. Hobbles over and opens the door. Howard all but tumbles into the room, having had his ear against the door. Michelle tamps down her surprise and makes her way around back into the --
Leaning on her crutches, she opens the cupboard. Every sq inch is taken up with canned goods and dried foods. Michelle turns to Howard.
How do you know my name?

I looked in your purse, saw your driver’s license. She works her way to the back corner. She tries the steel door next to the wine rack. The deadbolt is locked. Howard watches her but doesn't say anything. Michelle takes a seat on the couch, cranes her head to lo up the stairwell but she can't see where it ends. She tries to act calm and confident --
Okay. So where the hell are we?
Near Kenosha. 40 miles outside of Milwaukee. Underneath my farmhouse.  13.
(looking at the wine rack) Where you just happen to have a fully stocked dungeon.

I converted this cellar into a fallout shelter right after 9/11. The electricity comes from solar panels mounted on the barn roof. Water’s piped in from a well underneath the house then it goes through a reverse osmosis filter. Completely self contained. Howard leans against the table.
Started to think I went a little overboard, but figured, even if it never serves its purpose, it makes a decent wine cellar.
How were you able to figure out what happened? The TV and radio would have stopped broadcasting the instant the bomb went off.
The ones from Milwaukee did. But I was able to pick up a station from Chicago... until that cut out too. But it was enough info to know I needed to get here quick. Michelle loses a bit of confidence.
You saying Chicago was hit?
All I know is that they’re not broadcasting anymore.

That’s where I’m from. That’s where my mom is. I need to call her. I need to make sure she’s okay. The look on Howard's face says that she’s probably not. Michelle tears up. Howard’s not sure what to do, what to  14.
I have a daughter in Washington, D.C. I don’t know if anything happened there. But, I mean, it’s Washington, D.C. He fights back his own emotions.
Never should have let her go.
We need to go outside. Find a cell signal. Figure out what happened. Howard comes over, reaches out to comfort her.
I’m sorry. I know it’s hard, but I can’t let -- She suddenly swings her crutch --
Get the hell away from me, you lying son of a bitch! Michelle struggles to her feet, backs against a wall. She keeps Howard at bay with her crutch.

You're full of shit! There was no attack. You’re just a sick pervert trying to keep me down here. Howard looks at her, his face a blank slate. And then -- flash of anger. He pulls the couch away from the stairs.
You want to see what’s out there? (motioning toward stairs) Go ahead. Howard keeps his distance as Michelle cautiously crutches way to the steps, struggles to climb them.
Michelle arrives at the top of the stairs and finds a thi lead door with a small 4x6 inch window. Howard comes halfway up the stairs behind Michelle.  15.

Have a look. Michelle leans in and stares out the window -- MICHELLE’S POV - EVENING Late afternoon. Faint sunlight. A thin strip of the outsi world is visible along the top of the exterior stairwell Sunlight kicks off the front end of a dented pickup which barely sticks out from behind the corner of a rundown bar Outside the barn, there’s a fenced in pen occupied by -- TWO DEAD PIGS. But not just dead -- their skin is complet gone -- peeled, sliced or melted away. All that remains a two huge blobs of blood-stained muscle and fat.
Michelle pulls away. Terror pulses through her body.
Believe me now? Howard climbs the stairs as Michelle tries to get her panicked breathing under control.
Mildred and Frank. They seemed fine when we got here. I looked out a few hours later. That’s what I saw.
What happened to them?
I don’t know. Howard flips a switch on a kluged together piece of electronic equipment by the door. A steady CLICKING SOUND emanates from the machine as the meter fluctuates slightl
This is a Geiger counter. A wire runs from the device to a wand. Howard threads the wand through a small hole in the door. The clicking speed and the meter moves but only a little.  16.
Definitely radioactive fallout in the air, but not enough to do that kind of damage, not that quickly.
Yeah. Looks more like the work of some twisted freak with a knife.
(to himself) God grant me the serenity... Howard pulls the wand in. Looks up at Michelle.
There’s something else out there. Some sort of chemical, like mustard gas... or worse. Michelle subtly braces herself against the wall.

Whatever it is, we sure as hell can’t open this door. Without warning -- Michelle shoves Howard as hard as she He loses balance, tumbles down the steps, ass over elbows Michelle grabs the door handle, turns it. But it's locked
God damn it! Michelle frantically pulls at the door. Howard gets to his feet -- his body fills the bottom of t stairwell, blocking the light from the room. Michelle bangs on the small window.
Help! Somebody help me! Howard rubs his shoulder as he climbs the stairs.

What the hell is wrong with you?! There's real anger in his voice.  17. Michelle smashes her crutch against the glass, against th handle, but it’s pointless. She begins sobbing, slides do the wall until her butt hits the stairs.
Please let me go. Please. I promise, I won’t tell anyone. Howard stops a few steps below her.
(bordering on creepy) There’s no one to tell. Michelle looks up at Howard, horrified.
How long are you going to keep me here?
You're not a prisoner.
(through her sobs) Then open the fucking door. Howard leans in, breathing right in her ear. Michelle cowers as his hand reaches toward her... then pa her. He switches off the Geiger counter.
You're not thinking straight. Probably have a concussion. Then there’s the shock of all this info. Howard stands back up, towering over her.

You open that door and whatever’s out there comes in here. Is that what you want? To end up looking like my hogs? Michelle can’t tell if it’s a warning or a threat. They stare at each other for a long moment. She finally shakes her head... surrenders. Howard turns, lumbers back down the stairs. And as he goe the sun sets outside, leaving Michelle in near darkness.  18.
Looking in the mirror, Michelle peels the blood-crusted g off her forehead. The cut is still gruesome, but the blee has stopped. She tapes on a clean piece of gauze.
Howard sits at the table fiddling with a small radio but nothing's being broadcast. Michelle crutches into the room. Howard looks over.
(spinning the dial) See?
I see a broken radio. Howard shakes his head as Michelle crutches by him.
Michelle sleeps restlessly.
Michelle pushes through partying students on the porch as storms out of the house toward her car. Patrick continues after her.
Come on, Michelle. I made a mistake. Give me another chance.
(slurring slightly) Same thing my dad used to say. And my mom was stupid enough to believe it. Until he left her for good.
This is about you and me. Not them. Michelle opens her car door.  19.
You're right. It's about you and me. And Lauren. And that's one too many. She gets in the car and slams the door. Patrick grabs the handle but it's already locked.
Get out of the car. You're not alright to drive. Seriously. Michelle peels away from the curb -- Two students jump out of the way. She squeals around a corner and disappears into the night
Michelle wakes with a start. She looks over to -- HOWARD standing silently in the doorway. He turns and wal away without a word.
Michelle inspects her damaged knee. Then she glances at Howard’s dresser drawers. She crutches toward them, keepi nervous eye on the door to the main room.
You alright in there? She stops.
Yeah. I’m fine.
Howard and Michelle sit at the table, eating in silence. looks at her, but she keeps her eyes on her plate.
(trying for small talk) What were you doing in Milwaukee? Eyes down, Michelle pushes her food around with her fork.  20.

(almost robotic) Visiting a friend. (a beat) But he’s probably dead, right? So what’s the point in talking about it? So much for small talk. Howard bites his tongue as he pus away from the table. FADE TO BLACK.

A few days have passed. Michelle looks at herself in the mirror. She peels the gauze from her head. The wound is healed enough that she doesn’t replace the gauze. She runs water but sneaks from the bathroom -- using the noise to mask her movement. She hobbles into -- HOWARD’S ROOM She crosses the room without her crutches, limping but mo reasonably well. Michelle opens a drawer and takes the magazine with the “ TO MAKE A WEAPON OUT OF ANYTHING” cover.
Michelle maneuvers through the main room -- past Howard. leans heavily on the crutches making it appear that she’s completely dependent on them to get around.

Using the sharp edge of a soup can lid, Michelle whittles away at the end of one of her crutches, slowly shaping it into a point. She hears Howard moving outside and quickly rewraps the end with tape.
Michelle lies on her mattress as Howard unwraps the banda on her knee. Michelle winces as the last layer sticks to pus-covered wound. Howard tugs it off.  21.
Ow! Damn it. That hurt. They both stare at the wound. It’s gruesome.
I need to go to a hospital. I need a real doctor. Howard ignores the dig.
Where are you hiding them?
What are you talking about?
The antibiotics. Michelle doesn’t answer.

Think you'll still be able to refuse medicine when this turns into gangrene... and I have to saw your leg off? Michelle looks from the wound to Howard. He’s serious. She reaches into a small slit on the side of her mattress digs out a dozen pills. She sets them on the bed. Howard separates them into two piles.

(pointing at one pile) You’re welcome to suffer through the pain all you want... (points at the other pile) But you will take the antibiotics. Michelle picks up one pill from each pile. Pops them both into her mouth and swallows.
Happy? Howard rewraps Michelle’s knee with a clean bandage then up and heads for the door.

I’m stuck down here too, you know.  22. He pulls the door shut on his way out. Michelle reaches over and grabs her crutch. She unravels duct tape and goes back to work, sharpening it into a poi The painkiller kicks in. She groggily tucks the lid back under the mattress then lies down and drifts to sleep.

Michelle speeds on a winding country road. A truck pulls behind her. Its LIGHTS GLARE in her rearview mirror. It s to get closer and closer. Michelle swerves across the road drunkenly. The truck HON She guns the engine, accelerates. The truck keeps pace, tailgating her yet again. She glances at her rearview. The glare blinds her...

Michelle jolts awake. The bedroom door is open, but she’s alone. She reaches fo her crutches, notices that the tape at the foot of one of them is unraveled, the carved point clearly visible. She grabs it and tapes it up. But she has no idea if Howa was in the room to see it or not. She lies back on the bed for a moment, listens. Nothing b the WHOOSH of air coming in through the vent above her. Michelle stares up at the vent -- an idea comes to her. S grabs her crutches and limps out of the room.

Michelle peeks into Howard’s room. He snores on his mattr She quietly closes his door then stares up at the ventila system above the kitchenette where two air ducts branch o from the main register and pipe into the bedrooms.  23.
Michelle strips the cover from her pillow. She uses the s point on her crutch to rip one end open and begins pullin out the polyester stuffing.

Michelle climbs onto a folding chair beneath the main ven She pulls off the cover and shoves the stuffing into the ventilation system. When she has it all in, she takes a crutch and pushes it far into the duct as possible. She climbs off the chair then reaches up and BANGS on the vent with her crutch until Howard's snoring stops. She hears him moving and quickly limps back into her room
Michelle catches a glimpse of Howard through the open doo She waits a beat then hobbles out of the bedroom.
Howard is on a chair underneath the main duct. His ear an his hand are pressed up against the vent. Howard turns to Michelle -- deadly serious look on his fa
The ventilation system is failing. Michelle’s face gives nothing away.
What are you gonna do?
Don’t know. If it’s the solar panels we’re screwed because I can’t go outside to repair them. He turns valves on the ducts that lead into the bedrooms.  24.
I’m shutting down the bedroom flow. We'll have to limit ourselves to this room. Keep the system from having to work so hard. He gets down from the chair.
What about the bathroom?
I‘ll keep a bucket in here. Short of that, you'll have to be quick. Howard seems to be staring at the tape on the bottom of Michelle’s crutches as he speaks.
Michelle sets two plates on the table, unidentifiable blo of canned meat and pale vegetables on both.
Two years worth of food down here and not a single piece of chocolate. Howard stands on a folding chair, his face against the ve
Surviving is about the essentials. Michelle drops into a chair, exhausted. She stares at the wall of wine, looks around the rest of the sparse room.
Yeah, there’s no way a bag of chocolates would've fit in here.

Tell you what. Next time I’m planning for the apocalypse, I'1l make sure to buy candy bars. Right now we have more pressing problems. He gets down from the chair and joins Michelle at the tab They both struggle to catch their breath.
(somber ) We're not getting enough oxygen. (MORE )
I might have to go outside and see if I can fix it.
Thought it was poisonous outside.
It is. But we’re facing carbon dioxide poisoning down here. Something has to be done. Howard picks up a fork and starts eating. Michelle just stares at her plate. Is she having second thoughts?
If this crap is our last meal, we need something better than water to wash it down. She crutches over to the wine rack and grabs a random bot
You’re not old enough for that.
Feel free to call the cops. She sets the bottle on the table, hobbles over and digs through the utensil drawer.
You were drinking the night you crashed. I could smell it on you.
(laughs) Then drunk driving saved my life. Otherwise I’d be a skinless corpse, right? (frustrated) Where’s the corkscrew?

I’ve never opened a bottle down here. It’s just storage. Guess we'll have to make do with water. Michelle pulls off her shoe. She grabs the bottle and put the base of it in the bottom of the shoe then starts gent banging it against the nearby door frame.
What are you doing?  26.

Most parents won't notice if a bottle of wine disappears, but they will notice a missing corkscrew. Michelle is breathing heavily from the lack of oxygen, bu little by little the wine forces the cork from the bottle When it’s halfway up, she twists it the rest of the way o She takes a moment to catch her breath, then fills her gl She goes to fill Howard’s glass. He holds his hand over i
I don’t drink. Michelle looks over at the wall of wine.
That just decorative? Howard looks down at his dinner plate.
I used to. I don’t anymore. Michelle raises her glass.
More for me then. Cheers. She takes a big swig.
Michelle’s food is still uneaten but the wine bottle is h empty. The lack of oxygen mixed with the booze has her ti She refills her glass.
You’ve had enough. Michelle picks up her glass and takes a gulp. She looks a the full wine rack.
Why keep all those bottles if you don’t drink?
It’s a long story.  27.
(sarcastic) Yeah, maybe you can tell me some day when we have more time. Howard shrugs.
Maybe I‘11 tell you some day when you’re ready to listen. Michelle stares at the unappetizing food on the plate in front of her.

I can’t look at this shit anymore. Michelle, still tipsy, grabs her plate and limps over to sink WITHOUT HER CRUTCHES. Howard watches her intently as she makes her way back to table and sits down next to her forgotten crutches.
(suspiciously) Your knee’s getting a lot better. Michelle takes another drink of wine, plays it cool.

Guess the alcohol numbs the pain. Howard nods dubiously. All of a sudden, he gets up from h chair and walks to the back of the room. He digs a small ring out of his pocket and opens up the locked closet doo Howard pulls out the shovel before closing the door and locking it.
What are you doing?

Wondering how I could be so naive. Howard walks underneath the main duct, tapping it with th shovel handle as he goes. TAP -- a hollow echo. TAP -- another hollow echo. TAP -- hollow sound. Howard glances at Michelle. She fights to keep a disinterested look on her face.  28. He walks a few more feet. Reaches up, TAPS again -- and t part of the duct answers with a muted THUMP. Howard climbs onto a chair. He pushes the shovel deep int the vent and starts fishing around. Michelle surreptitiously unwraps the tape from the bottom her crutch under the table as she keeps her eyes on Howar Howard pulls the shovel out, bringing a big chunk of polyester pillow stuffing with it. Air immediately starts flowing into the room again. Howard looks at Michelle. He’s furious.

I pulled you from a crushed car. Kept you safe from whatever’s in the air out there. I gave you antibiotics from my limited supply. He climbs off the chair, shakes the edge of the shovel at as he speaks. He doesn’t seem to notice her shaky hands working underneath the table.

You were a stranger. I owed you nothing. But I helped you anyhow. And instead of thanking me, you try to kill us both. Howard takes a step toward Michelle. She jumps up from th table and thrusts her spike-tipped crutch at Howard. He knocks it aside with the shovel. She pulls it back, ready to strike again.
Is that your plan? Lock me up and keep telling me how thankful I should be until I throw myself at you? Well, it’s never gonna happen. (raises the spear higher) I won’t let you hurt me.
That’s the beauty of it. I don’t have to. He throws the shovel down.  29.
I’m gonna let you hurt yourself. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out his key ring. Se it on the table.
It’s the small brass one. Michelle hesitates for a long moment, not sure if she believes him, not sure if this is some kind of a test.

You're free to go. Howard drags the couch away from the stairwell. Keeping the crutch pointed in front of her, Michelle step forward, grabs the keys off the table. She limps toward the exit, crutch at the ready.
There's just one thing... Howard’s voice wavers between menace and regret.

Once you leave, you can't come back. You'll be covered with whatever it is that melted the skin off my hogs. Go ahead and kill yourself if you like. But I’m not going to let you kill me too. Your choice. Michelle makes her way into the --

She slowly climbs the stairs. Daylight filters in through tiny window above. She gets to the top, fumbles with the key ring -- She sticks the small brass key in the lock -- She pauses, looks back down the stairs. Howard’s nowhere be seen. But he calls out --  30.

Leave the keys in the door. And be quick to close it. Michelle pauses... Decision time. She hesitates -- And then the daylight from the window suddenly goes DARK. Michelle spins around -- a man in a hazmat hood presses against the window -- looking right at her. He BANGS frantically.
(muffled) Open the door! Open the god damn door! Michelle SCREAMS in terror. Howard rushes to the bottom of the stairs, sees the figur the other side of the window --

Do not open that door! Michelle panics, spins the key, unlocking the door. Before Howard can get up to her, the man pulls open the d and enters, pushing into Michelle -- TOUCHING HER -- The man blocks Michelle from getting out. He spins back, shuts and locks the door. Then strips off his hazmat hood
(whispering) Shh! We don’t want them to find us. This is NATE (20s), his matted hair and dirty face only enhance his rugged good looks.
Who?

(whispering) Get back! Get away from me! Howard disappears down the stairwell. Michelle hesitates. Maybe it’s the booze or the lack of oxygen -- or maybe it something in Nate’s voice that convinces her. But Michell backs down the stairs, away from the door.  31. Nate looks out the window one more time before he heads d into the --
Howard stands on a chair under the vent, turning the valv on the ducts that lead to the bedrooms.
We need to get that suit cleaned off. Right now. Nate hurries past Michelle into Howard’s room -- he clear knows his way around.
What the hell is going on?
(a concerned look) That’s Nate.
You know him? Howard nods, but not happily. He gets down from the chair heads for his bedroom.

Nate strips off the suit. Underneath he’s only wearing a of boxers and few tattoos. He throws the suit in the tub. Howard comes in and starts running the water over it. Nate looks back, sees Michelle in the bedroom doorway. He hurries into -- HOWARD’S ROOM -- in just his boxers. Michelle can’t help but notice Nat in great shape.
You touched the suit. You need to get washed off right away. He reaches for her. She doesn’t resist. He leads her back the --  32.
Howard scrubs the suit which is completely submerged. Nat holds a towel under the faucet -- but the water flow has reduced to a drip. Nate begins to put the towel in the tu
No! Water might be contaminated. Howard closes the faucet.
Try the sink. Nate spins the sink faucet. It sputters and a weak stream water flows out. Nate wets the towel as he turns to Michelle.
Those clothes have to go. Throw ‘em in the tub with the suit. Then wash yourself down.
What?

If you want to keep your skin, you need to lose your clothes. Now! Michelle takes the towel, pauses, looks at Nate then Howa who’s paying no attention as he cleans the hazmat suit. Nate sighs, turns away from her.
No time to be modest. Michelle strips down to her underwear. Nate keeps his back to her, but turns enough to sneak a p in the mirror as Michelle washes herself down with the to

He turns the hazmat suit inside out to scrub the rest. And he sees -- written on the inside in permanent marker: PROPERTY OF JOHN BENNETT, PIKEVILLE FIRE DEPT.  33. Howard stares at the name, his face tightening up. He gla at Nate, who still has his back turned.
Nate, now in a pair of Howard’s jeans and a t-shirt, sits the table with Howard. They speak in tense whispers.
Got some nerve showing up here now.
You said I was always welcome.
A lot’s changed since then. And you know it. Michelle walks in, dressed in a different set of clothes. Nate eyes her as she heads for the couch.
(to Howard) A little greedy wanting to keep this all for yourself. She sits on the couch and looks at the men distrustfully.
(to Howard, re: Nate) He was out there. He seems fine.
Because of the hazmat suit. (stares at Nate) Lucky you happened to have that.
(to Howard) This all part of the plan? You couldn’t convince me so you called for backup.
